p.s: Fast Fashion - Is History Repeating Itself?
The world is becoming increasingly globalized.
Often times we don't even know where our products come from - the supply chains are increasingly more convoluted.
But when it comes to clothing - one aspect is deeply disturbing - how our clothing gets sewn.
MÃ¼ller-Hellmanntraveledtravelled to Bangladesh to see the process for herself.
She visited a river near the city Dhaka around which 3000-4000 factories all dump their trash and sewage into.
The riverbanks are covered in piles of trash - that's where the people live.
The work itself, she said, is extremely monotone with 10-12h workshifts 6 days a week.
What can be done to prevent this?
Well, she urges to not just stop buying their clothes - people's livelyhood depends on it.
Instead, she proposes, we have to make the labels accountable for their explotationexploitation and act politically to advocate for better conditions.
In conclusion it is clear that miserable working conditions are a global issue - one that cannot and should not be ignored and needs to be solved.
